page.title: 07BLACKLAW SCHOOL E. KILBRIDE
page.content: BLACKLAW SCHOOL-EAST KILBRIDE Blacklaw Farm was owned by Mrs.Jean Cameron a long time before it became a school.Mrs.Cameron was a supporter of Bonnie Prince Charlie.She came from a place in Invernesshire,called Glen Dessary.In her will it was said that she wanted to be buried in her homeland.Instead she was buried in a corner of her estate in East Kilbride now known as Glen Dessary.The house where Jean Cameron lived was called Blacklaw House.It was demolished in 1958.There is a public house in the area called"THE BONNIE PRINCE CHARLIE" It is called that because of the relationship with the Jacobites.On our school badge is a black triangle to represent a blacklaw.A"blacklaw"is a small hill or ridge.There is also a Jacobite cockade resting on the St.Andrew's Flag.
